title.narrative: ZAM / 2410 Voice of the Youth in Governance

description.narrative: Youth participation and representation in governance structures in Zambia is very low although they constitute a major part of the population. This project builds the capacity of young people in the areas of advocacy budget tracking and corruption as well as creates dialogue opportunities between the youth and decision-makers through radio listener clubs and dialogue forums. The aim is on one hand to improve the accountability of local-level committees and funds. On the other the project also aims to enhanc e and strengthen youth participation in such committees for young people to be able to better advocate on issues important to them. The project also trains local radio producers on governance issues and listener club management to engage a broader group of youth and community members on these issues.The direct benefiaries are 228 young people who are already involved in various local committees. The project will last for one year and be implemented in five districts Mongu Livingstone Monze Kaoma and Lusaka.
